issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5.Description

We're adding support for VS 2017, as we do this we should evaluate whether VS 2013 still has a place in our support matrix (imo it doesn't) and if we decide it doesn't. We should

* Output a warning stating that VS 2013 support was deprecated of X and will be removed in <NEXT_MAJOR> (could possibly do this around here https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile_windows/blob/master/cli/commands/_build/initialize.js#L58-L62) after we determine the version?
fields.summary: Windows: Officially deprecate support for Visual Studio 2013

comments.body: It appears to already be deprecated: https://wiki.appcelerator.org/display/guides2/Titanium+Compatibility+Matrix#TitaniumCompatibilityMatrix-SupportedversionsofVS.
